qas:
Q: How do you create a basic cube in SketchUp?
A: To create a basic cube in SketchUp, select the Rectangle tool, draw a square on the ground plane, then use the Push/Pull tool to extrude it upward to your desired height.

Q: What is the purpose of groups in SketchUp?
A: Groups in SketchUp are used to organize geometry and prevent unwanted connections between separate objects. They help maintain clean models and make editing easier.

Q: How do you change the camera view in SketchUp?
A: You can change the camera view in SketchUp using the Orbit tool to rotate around your model, the Pan tool to move the view, and the Zoom tool to get closer or farther from your work.
